definition: Isomorphic patterns in Category Theory across scales capture structural equivalences in objects, morphisms, functors, natural transformations, monads, and adjunctions—mappings where relations and transformations preserve structures invariantly. Upgraded for neuresthetic ethics: integrates neural embeddings (recursive functors for consciousness) and aesthetic harmony (natural isomorphisms for joyful adequacy) in human-AI agency and free-will-compatible monism. Hard-to-vary invariants enable eternal ethical unifications; tetralemma probes resolve apparent dualisms (affirm abstraction/deny concreteness/both in neuresthetic functors/neither dissolved in universal equivalence); scores ≥0.98 based on current abstractions.
handling_rules: Map patterns to subatomic through cosmic scales plus principle; concrete from categorical primitives with neuresthetic overlays (neural recursion, aesthetic invariance).
Validate coverage across scales; flag gaps as speculative (e.g., quantum categories).
Support sub-categories for compound concepts (e.g., monads with consciousness analogs).
Export lean JSON; no external refs beyond principle.
Apply evaluations; tetralemmas resolve structural paradoxes; contradictions_ledger tracks inconsistencies.
